sentence.Network_en: He's offered us his villa by the sea for two weeks. The only problem is that we can only have it in February, which rather takes the gilt off the gingerbread.
sentence.Network_cn: 他把海边的别墅让给我们住两个星期. 但是美中不足的是我们只能在二月份去, 这就有些扫兴了.

sentence.Network_en: The high taxes that I paid took the gilt off the gingerbread.
sentence.Network_cn: 我缴付的高额税款除去了我大部分的收入.

sentence.Network_en: I wouldn't go halves in the toffee and gingerbread on purpose to save the money.
sentence.Network_cn: 为了把钱省下来,我不肯把太妃糖和甜饼分给别人.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (originally denoting preserved ginger), from Old French gingembrat, from medieval Latin gingibratum, from gingiber (see ginger). The change in the ending in the 15th cent. was due to association with bread

entry.def: Gingerbread is a sweet biscuit or cookie that is flavoured with ginger. It is often made in the shape of a man or an animal.
